1562163868_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4.body:
>Should (what?) regular zeronet layman user do about this?

Wait for @nofish to approve these changes and be pulled into the main repository, then wait for a new update.

From [@nofish on GitHub](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/2068#issuecomment-508551809)
>It's not just about cpu, but bw: torrent trackers requires separate request for every site, for zero trackers you can announce multiple sites in one request.
>So if you have 100 site you need to send 100 request every 20 minute for every torrent tracker.

I've run into trouble trying to download thousands of sites from ZeroNet and I've identified Torrent trackers as being the main bottle-neck, I didn't actually know zero:// where that much ~~different~~ better than Torrent trackers but knowing this I think the sharing of udp:// and http(s):// Torrent trackers is not necessary if zero:// trackers are already being shared among peers.

Maybe the first point of the pull request (sharing of Torrent trackers) can be omitted and still be merged?

Thanks a lot by the way @nofish you're doing a wonderful job

Hm, maybe Torrent trackers can still be shared among peers but not used unless zero:// trackers don't work? I think @nofish wants to phase out support for Torrent trackers and move to zero:// trackers.

Agreed, it doesn't change stuff too much and might actually help the network. But I think zero:// trackers should be prioritized somehow, and only a limited amount of trackers should be used because it is true that Torrent trackers require much more bandwidth if you're seeding many sites.

Is an announce every 20 minutes a requirement for Torrent trackers? Or can it be a few hours or something?
